page.title: 01EDWINSTOWE:AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Edwinstowe}is a{coalmining village on the banks of the{River Maun in the heart of {Nottinghamshire's {Sherwood Forest.}Edwinstowe was a small village in the centre of the{ {Dukeries.} The{Dukeries}was named after the {Duke of Portland at Welbeck Abbey,Duke {of Norfolk at Worksop Manor,Duke of {Newcastle at Clumber Park,Duke of {Kingston at Thoresby Park}(more recently the Earl Manvers),{Duke of {Leeds at Kiveton Park,}and finally { {Lord Savile at Rufford Abbey. { }Edwinstowe now consists of three main parts. The{"Pit Village"} was built to house the sinkers and later other miners at{Thoresby Pit.}The estate now belongs to the{National {Coal Board}but many miners are now buying their own homes,here and on the {Council Estate}and{private housing.
